New Records: Austria's 3-2 win over the Netherlands was one of the outstanding performances of the European Championships

Key Match Events: Donyell Malen scored an own goal to give Austria the lead
Xavi Simons made a difference by finding Gakpo in the left channel, and the Liverpool winger cut expertly inside his marker and curled right-footed into the far corner for the equaliser
Romano Schmid scored a spectacular diving header into the bottom corner for Austria's second goal
Marcel Sabitzer scored a high-past Verbruggen from a narrow angle to seal the win for Austria

Austria's ultra-collectivist ethos has taken them to heights they have never seen any Austrian team reach
Post-Match Reflections: Ronald Koeman was helpless to prevent the same thing happening to his side in the initial stages at the Olympiastadion
The Austrian fans behind Bart Verbruggen's goal were celebrating the opening goal after just nine minutes

Miscellaneous Highlights: The trend towards more own goals has to do with the increased prevalence of low driven crosses that bounce off defenders before they have time to react
